id1.name: Granny Smith Apples
id1.description: Apples are known for their sweet and tart taste, and come in a variety of colors and sizes depending on the variety. Apples are also known for their nutritional value, as they are a good source of fiber, vitamin C, and antioxidants.

id2.name: Fresh Raspberries
id2.description: Raspberries are a sweet and tart fruit that are a good source of nutrients. They are low in calories and high in fiber, and are rich in vitamins and minerals.

id3.name: Broccoli Crowns
id3.description: Broccoli is a nutritious vegetable that is part of the cruciferous family of vegetables, which also includes kale, cauliflower, and Brussels sprouts.

id4.name: Strawberry
id4.description: Strawberries are known for their bright red color, juicy texture, and sweet, slightly tart taste. In addition to their taste, strawberries are also a good source of vitamins, minerals, and antioxidants.

nutritions.vitamin_c: 113% of the Daily Value (DV) per cup

id5.name: Red Bell Peppers
id5.description: Red bell peppers are a type of sweet pepper that are known for their bright red color, mild flavor, and crunchy texture.

id6.name: Navel Orange
id6.description: They are known for their bright orange color, sweet taste, and juicy texture. Oranges are a good source of vitamins, minerals, and antioxidants.

id7.name: Tomato on the Vine
id7.description: Tomatoes are a popular fruit (although commonly thought of as a vegetable) that are widely used in cooking and known for their sweet, juicy flavor.

id8.name: Green Leaf Lettuce
id8.description: Lettuce is a leafy green vegetable that is commonly used in salads and sandwiches.
